sentences: Despina Vandi (Greek: Δέσποινα Βανδή, pronounced [ˈðespina vanˈði]), born as Despina Malea (Δέσποινα Μαλέα) on 22 July 1969, is a Greek singer.
section: N/A

sentences: Born in Tübingen near Stuttgart, Germany, Vandi's family returned to Kavala, Greece when she was six years old.
section: N/A

sentences: After moving to Athens in the early 1990s, Vandi signed with Minos EMI and released two albums Gela Mou (1994) and Esena Perimeno (1996).
section: N/A

sentences: She then began an exclusive collaboration with songwriter/producer Phoebus and struck commercial success with her third album, Deka Endoles (1997), followed by the multi-platinum Profities (1999), as she established a more "pop" stage performance style and image, becoming one of the most prominent artists of the laïko/pop genre.
section: N/A

sentences: Her single "Ipofero" (2000) became the best-selling single of all-time in Greece.
section: N/A

sentences: Following Phoebus' departure from Minos EMI, Vandi followed him to the newly formed independent label Heaven Music and released Gia (2001), which became and remains her biggest commercial success, as well as one of the best-selling albums of all time in Greece and Cyprus.
section: N/A

sentences: Vandi also released the album abroad and the self-titled single "Gia", topping the US Billboard Hot Dance Airplay and making her the first Greek artist to top a Billboard chart.
section: N/A

sentences: She returned with Stin Avli Tou Paradeisou (2004), which was certified multi-platinum and became her fourth album to achieve six-figure sales.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2007 10 Hronia Mazi, a ten-year celebration of her collaboration with Phoebus was released, followed by her eighth studio album C'est La Vie.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2012 she released the album Allaxa, which was certified 2x platinum sales and has been her first double platinum record since 2005.
section: N/A

sentences: Vandi has won three Arion Music Awards, ten MAD Video Music Awards, seven Pop Corn Music Awards, and a World Music Award, becoming the first Greek artist recording in Greece to ever win the award.
section: N/A

sentences: On 14 March 2010, Alpha TV ranked Vandi the fourth top-certified Greek female artist in the nation's phonographic era (since 1960), with 11 records having been certified platinum or multi-platinum and three gold by the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry of Greece.
section: N/A

sentences: According to Heaven Music, as of 2007, Vandi has sold one million records in Greece.
section: N/A

sentences: In the aftermath of her success, Vandi gained the title of the "queen" of Greek music.
section: N/A

sentences: From 2013 to 2015, she was one of the four artists/coaches participating in the Greek version of The Voice called The Voice of Greece.
section: N/A

sentences: And she was one of the four artists/coaches in Rising Star in 2016.

sentences: "Koritsi Prama, Part 1", was released on 22 March and was the lead single from her eighth studio album, "C' est la vie".
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The pop song written by Phoebus was the first release coordinated by The Spicy Effect label.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The music video was filmed on 22 March at "Diogenis Studio".
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The song was the first half of a two-part work Vandi released "Koritsi Prama, Part 2", two months later, on 14 May 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The new album of Despina Vandi, called C'est La Vie, was released on 13 June with Real News newspaper.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: It was her first album to be released along with a newspaper, following a popular tendency of the Greek musical industry, as an effort to deal with the reduction in the disc sales.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The newspaper, along with the album, sold more than 100,000 copies.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: On the other hand, this release choice resulted in the album receiving no official certification of gold sales, for the first time for a Vandi album after her early releases at the first half of the 1990s.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: On 14 June, Vandi performed live at the MAD Video Music Awards, presenting her new song "Kommati Ap' Tin Kardia Sou".
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The song was also the following single of the album C'est La Vie and was released on 7 June 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The video clip was released on 5 July 2010 and made positive impressions, revealing a "rock side" of Vandi.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The third single of the album, "Erota Theli I Zoi", was released to radio stations on 13 September 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The music video, filmed on the Greek island of Hydra, was uploaded on 19 October 2010 on Spicy's YouTube Channel.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: Furthermore, the German band Schiller, who had worked with Vandi in the past, released a new song featuring her as vocals, called Sunday and included it in their album Breathless, the international version of Schiller's album Atemlos.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The song was also included in the album C'est La Vie.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: Vandi was also the first artist who took part in the MTV Unplugged concert series of the music channel MTV Greece.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: The concert took place in the theater Hora in Kypseli on 9 June.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: She later went on a tour around Greece, along with Elli Kokkinou.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: After the successful concerts all over the Greece, Vandi performed live on 31 October at HMV Forum of London.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: It was the first time for Vandi in London and it was also a sold out.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: After the concert, she appeared at the music scene VOX and after five months, the show finished on 6 March.
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===

sentences: On 14 June 2011 Despina Vandi appeared on Mad Video Music Awards 2011 and performed the song "Gi' Alli Mia Fora" (For one more time).
section: == Life and career == | === C'est La Vie (2010) ===
== Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: Allaxa (2012)
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===
== Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: In November 2011 a digital single was released by Vandi called "Mou 'His Perasi", as a promo to Despina's forthcoming album.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: The music was written by Gavrilis Mosas and the lyrics by Phoebus.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: The video clip, filmed in the area of the Messolonghi lagoon was also released the same month.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: The song's release was followed by another digital single taken from her 9th studio album, called Girismata.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: On late 2011 Vandi's appearances began at the nightclub FEVER along with Elli Kokkinou and Nikos Ikonomopoulos.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: On 2012 the album Allaxa was released, marking Vandi's return to a more laïko genre after the poorly received C' est la vie album.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: Apart from Phoebus there is a collaboration with songwriters such as Eleni Giannatsoulia, Olga Vlahopoulou, Vangelis Kostantinidis and Gavrilis Mosas.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===

sentences: The album was certified double-platinum sales and re-established Vandi's commercial success with multiple hits such as: Mou 'His Perasi, Girismata, To asteri mou, To nisi (its videoclip was filmed in the island of Skiathos) and Katalavaino.
section: == Life and career == | === Allaxa (2012) ===
== Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14)
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===
== Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: Despina has been offered many times to represent Greece in Eurovision song contest but she never accepted.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: On 15 January 2013 the Hellenic Broadcasting Corporation (ERT) announced that it had reached an agreement with private music channel MAD TV to take on the organisation and production of a national final to select a song to represent Greece in the contest.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: Despina Vandi was selected to host the event along with actor Giorgos Kapoutzidis.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: It was the first time that a well-known singer hosted such an event.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: The following year, Vandi and Kapoutzidis hosted again the event, called "Eurosong 2014: a MAD Show".
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: In 2013–2014 Vandi was one of the four artists/coaches participating in the Greek version of The Voice, along with Antonis Remos, Melina Aslanidou and Michalis Kouinelis.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: The winner of the show's first season, Maria Elena Kyriakou, was on Vandi's team.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: On the meantime Despina's digital single Hano Esena produced by Dimitris Kontopoulos was released on 2013, receiving positive reviews and remaining 10 weeks at the top of the airplay chart.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: In December 2014 Vandi released her new album 'De Me Stamatises' (including 10 tracks).
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: It was the first album since 1997, in which none of the songs was written by her long-time producer Phoebus.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: Instead, she collaborated again with various songwriters, among them: Dimitris Kontopoulos, Eleni Giannatsoulia, Olga Vlahopoulou, Giorgos Sampanis, Nikos Moraitis and Vasilis Gavriilidis.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: The first three new singles Kalimera, Ola allazoun and Kane kati, were released right after her return to Heaven Music.
section: == Life and career == | === Eurovision TV presenter – The Voice – De Me Stamatises (2013–14) ===

sentences: The album Afti Ine I Diafora Mas was released in October 2016 by Heaven Music.

sentences: Vandi collaborated again with various songwriters (among which Dimitris Kontopoulos, Thanos Papanikolaou, Nikos Moraitis, Eleni Giannatsoulia, Vasilis Gavriilidis, Olga Vlahopoulou).
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Her eleventh album features the following singles: 'Mia Anasa Makria Sou', 'O,ti Thes Geniete Tora', 'Gia Kaki Mou Tihi'.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Apart from her recordings, Vandi starred in the Greek version of the musical theater show – "Mamma Mia!", playing the role of Donna.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Vandi's performance as Donna was well-received among critics and audience.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: "Mamma Mia!" continued its success in the summer of 2018, with a big tour all around Greece.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: The show ended up doing a total of 300 shows and selling more than 100,000 tickets in the span of two years.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===
== Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Vandi continued her musical career starring in the star-studded musical show "To Diko Mas Cinema" (2019), directed by the famous creative duo Reppas - Papathanasiou.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: As expected the show was a huge commercial success selling more than 90.000 tickets during the summer of 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: It was the biggest commercial hit of the Greek summer theatrical season.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Inspired by the musical, she released the album "To Diko Mou Cinema" (2019), including covers of notable songs from popular Greek films produced in the 1960s and 1970s.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: In 2019, she produced and presented the travel show "My Greece".
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: Vandi visits a variety of Greek towns and villages showcasing their traditions, culture, local food, and history.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===

sentences: "My Greece" is currently on its third season.
section: == Life and career == | === Afti Ine I Diafora Mas – TV – Musicals (2016–2019) ===
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Although born in Germany, Vandi's family was from Kavala, Greece, where she and her family moved when she was six years old.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As a result, she did not learn German, unlike the rest of her family.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has one older brother and an older sister.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Living in a lower-middle-class family, her dream was to become either an actress or a singer
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: but she always knew that she should have something more solid as a background so she went on to study psychology, philosophy, and education at the University of Thessaloniki.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: When she first began singing, she used the stage name of "Elli Mara" before adopting the "Vandi" moniker, to hide that she was singing from her parents.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Despina Vandi was married to Demis Nikolaidis, ex-international soccer player and former president of AEK soccer club.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They announced their divorce in July 2021.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has a daughter named Melina who was born in February 2004 and a son named Giorgos who was born in August 2007.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On 18 August 2008, Vandi was in a car accident on Kifissias Avenue in Kifissia, Greece.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The car she was in, driven by her chauffeur, slipped on an oil slick that leaked from a tanker truck causing the car to crash into the truck ahead of her.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: After drivers helped pull her out of the vehicle, she was transported by ambulance to the general hospital in Athens.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Vandi only suffered a cut to her head and got stitches.
section: == Personal life ==
